title: Avengers' Chris Evans way too excited for Rick And Morty return
text:
He’s a keen bean (Picture: Getty; Warner Bros.)

Avengers star Chris Evans has cemented himself a true Rick And Morty fan as he awaited the return of the series.

Earlier this year he outed himself as a follower of the animated comedy, as it preps for a season four return next month.

He’d previously taken to Twitter and written: ‘There isn’t another show on television like @RickandMorty. It’s a true original.

‘And it’s awesome.’

Alright, we get it, Captain America, you’re a big ol’ fan of the show.

Giving us a mighty hint the Marvel star has some sort of countdown calendar in his house where he crosses each day off, Chris this week gave us a reminder for the premiere of the next season.

‘3 more weeks until Rick and Morty,’ he wrote on Twitter on Saturday, further firming up his keenness.

At the time of writing, the tweet nearly had 200,000 likes and over 35,000 retweets, showing his followers were right behind him in supporting the show.

Advertisement

Fans were all for Cap’s shout out, as they joined in and shared their excitement at the next season gracing our very being.

‘So what you are saying is you’re having a watch party at your house with @JustinRoiland and Dan Harmon and other writers, animators, etc? Well If theres room for one more I would gladly join you for the season premiere, Don’t worry I’ll be sure to bring the wafer cookies!’ one, perhaps too-keen punter chimed in with a comment.

The duo are making their return (Picture: Adult Swim)

One fan had a giggle as they replied: ‘this is your most “bro” tweet ever.’

Others were praising the Steve Rogers actor for encouraging them to Google Rick And Morty and discover a whole new, wacky TV show.

The MCU star is excited, even though the latest trailer took a cheeky dig at Cap’s fellow Avenger, Doctor Strange.

Creators Justin Roiland and Dan Harmon may have upset fans with only five episodes being released when the new season launches in November, but they look like they’re cramming a lot in.

Advertisement

Advertisement

And by that we mean, they’re taking the mick out of everyone and anyone.

In one quick clip, which appears to be at some intergalactic nightclub, Rick whips off his ever-present lab coat and commands it to ‘rip off Doctor Strange’.

Just like the trusty sentient cloak that comes in super handy for Benedict Cumberbatch’s time-manipulator, Rick’s coat flies off and wraps itself around a security guard that’s coming after him and his grandson, Morty.

Eat your heart out, Strange.

Rick and Morty seasons 1-3 are available on Channel 4, with season 4’s UK release date TBC.
